unit: Unit 6 | Inference for Categorical Data: Proportions
title: Take a Tablet
question_text: A company sold two tablet computers:  the Earth Tablet and the Air Tablet.  The company was looking to investigate whether men or women prefer either tablet. In a random sample of $60$ women, $70\%$ preferred the Earth Tablet.  A random sample of $60$ men showed that $50\%$ of them preferred the Earth Tablet.  Based on a $99\%$ confidence interval, can we be sure that women prefer the Earth Tablet more than the men?  Answer "yes" or "no" and state why.

choices.text: Yes. Clearly, 70 % 70 % is quite a bit greater than 50 % 50 % , so the women prefer the Earth Tablet.

Yes. We obtain a confidence interval of about ( .03 , 0.37 ) ( .03 , 0.37 ) .  Since zero is not included in the interval, we can be sure that the true proportion shows that women prefer the Earth Tablet more than men.

No. We obtain a confidence interval of about ( − .03 , 0.43 ) ( − .03 , 0.43 ) .  Since zero is included in the interval, we cannot be 99 % 99 % sure that the true proportion shows that women prefer the Earth Tablet more than men.
